docs.lead_paragraph: Can the plant made famous by the Chia Pet, the terra-cotta figurine that sprouts fuzzy green hair, help you lose weight?

docs.lead_paragraph: Jean Minarick has had a tough few weeks, grappling with one of the crossroads decisions that family members so often shoulder for ailing elders. "I've been a wreck," she said.
docs.abstract: Saying no to a feeding tube can feel tantamount to allowing a loved one to starve.
docs.snippet: Saying no to a feeding tube can feel tantamount to allowing a loved one to starve.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sweet potatoes provide a variety of vitamins and minerals in a low-calorie package. (Just don’t call them yams.) Today: sweet potatoes with a chili glaze.

headline.seo: Sweet Potatoes: Nutrition Wrapped in Vivid Flavors - Recipes for Health
headline.main: Sweet Potatoes: Nutrition Wrapped in Vivid Flavors
headline.print_headline: Sweet Potatoes: Nutrition Wrapped in Vivid Flavors

docs.snippet: Sweet potatoes provide a variety of vitamins and minerals in a low-calorie package. (Just don’t call them yams.) Today: sweet potatoes with a chili glaze.

docs.lead_paragraph: The chef Rick Bayless offers a wonderful recipe for sweet potatoes glazed with an ancho chile paste in his book “Rick Bayless’s Mexican Kitchen.” Instead of making the paste, I make a thinner glaze with canned chipotle and some of the adobo they’re packed in. The glaze makes a spicy contrast to the sweet potatoes. You can make this recipe vegan by using light brown sugar instead of honey.

headline.main: Sweet Potatoes: Nutrition Wrapped in Vivid Flavors

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. LaLanne found recognition through his obsession with grueling workouts and nutrition, complemented by a salesman’s gift.

headline.seo: Jack LaLanne, Father of Fitness Movement, Dies at 96
headline.main: Jack LaLanne, Founder of Modern Fitness Movement, Dies at 96

docs.snippet: Mr. LaLanne found recognition through his obsession with grueling workouts and nutrition, complemented by a salesman’s gift.

docs.lead_paragraph: SCHATZKIN--Arthur Gould, aged 62, died on January 20, 2011 after a year-long battle with glioblastoma. Dr. Schatzkin was a physician and Chief of the Nutritional Epidemiology Branch of the Division of Cancer Epidemiology at the National Cancer Institute and was an internationally renowned pioneer in the field of nutrition and cancer. He was the author of over 400 publications and cared deeply about the impact of his work on public health. Beloved husband of Tamara Harris Schatzkin, loving father of Eric and Rebecca and father-in-law of Gregory Vincent, cherished brother of Paul Schatzkin and Dorothy Schatzkin Higgins. Dr. Schatzkin graduated from Yale University in 1969, from SUNY Downstate College of Medicine in 1976, and from Columbia University School of Public Health, Sociomedical Sciences, in 1982. Arthur was a man of principle, passionate about his work, his family, and his hope of a better, more equal world. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in support of the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Donations are accepted online at www.fnih.org or by check at Foundation for NIH, 9650 Rockville Pike, Bethesda, MD 20814. Please indicate that this gift is in memory of Dr. Arthur Schatzkin in support of DCEG, NOB, and NCI research.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCHATZKIN, ARTHUR G.
